problem: Simplify and find the value of $\left\lceil\left(\frac{5}{3}\right)^3\right\rceil$.
solution: First, we compute the cube of the fraction: $$\left(\frac{5}{3}\right)^3 = \frac{125}{27} = 4 + \frac{17}{27}.$$ Because $0 \leq \frac{17}{27} < 1$, we apply the ceiling function: $$\left\lceil\left(\frac{5}{3}\right)^3\right\rceil = \left\lceil 4 + \frac{17}{27} \right\rceil = \boxed{5}.$$
